meanings.definition: The process by which a plant produces additional shoots or stems from the base of the main stem.
meanings.sent1: During tillering, the plant creates more stems for support.
meanings.sent2: Farmers observe tillering to understand the growth of crops.
meanings.sent3: The tillering of the wheat plant seemed like it was trying to hug the ground.
meanings.sent4: The tillering of the flowers in the garden was like a crowd of tiny green umbrellas opening up.
meanings.sent5: The tillering of the grass made the field look like a sea of green waves.

meanings.definition: The act of forming or developing new shoots or stems from the base of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The tillering of the tree signaled its healthy growth.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners pay attention to tillering to ensure proper plant development.
meanings.sent3: The tillering of the bush made it look like it was reaching out for a hug.
meanings.sent4: The tillering of the vine resembled a group of friends growing together.
meanings.sent5: The tillering of the plant was like nature's way of creating more beauty.

meanings.definition: The growth of new shoots or stems from the main stem of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The tillering of the rose bush added more flowers to the garden.
meanings.sent2: Botanists study tillering to understand plant propagation.
meanings.sent3: The tillering of the tomato plant made it look like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: The tillering of the bamboo was like a forest growing within a plant.
meanings.sent5: The tillering of the sunflower brought a burst of yellow to the field.
